Review Title: Good company, but pros and cons
Pros:
Overall, a decent company to work for, with good people, for the most part.

Starting pay is ok, but see the cons about how future increases go. Benefits are ok, but expensive.
Cons:
Management does not follow the guiding principles consistently. Lately, there has been high turnover in some departments. Be aware that with any Koch company, it’s all about adding value. In other words, going way beyond and above your job description. If you want any shot at a raise or a bonus, you better be ready to prove how you’re adding value to the organization.

Company match on HSA accounts is weak.

Review Title: It’s a job, no more free time
Pros: Coworkers are genuinely great people, the only reason I stuck around as long as I did. 3-weeks standard vacation.
Cons: No work-life balance. Be ready to be on calls at 6AM and 9PM on the same day 3-4 times a week and get paid below the market. You WILL be judged for not being available 24/7. Compensation and promotions are a 'buddy system' and double standards are ubiquitous with the management “clique”. Bait and switch in terms of responsibility when accepting roles, you will manage double what is originally mentioned. When numbers dip ever so slightly, downsizing happens FAST. You have no decision rights on your products, upper managment will make decisions for you then look to you for answers when things go south. YEARS of exceeding expectations on my yearly reviews with not one bonus, you have to go to war for raises.

Cons: Place closed down and is missed

Review Title: Poor Management - Doesn't Adhere to Koch's 8 Principles - Excessive employee turnover
Pros: Competitive pay and benefits. Great talent at the working level. Couldn't ask for better folks to work with.
Cons: Executive management is disconnected from the manager and working level associates. While this provides some autonomy, it more means management shows up late to the party, asking why things aren't working, when they should be better engaged and knowledgeable. Excessive employee churn kills the organization and tribal knowledge is at the bare minimum.

Review Title: Not a good company for Autosar Developer
Pros: Hybrid working culture No work pressure
Cons: Not a good company for Autosar Developer due to below reason. 1.Single Product in Automotive domain due to which less learning. 2.Allocation of work is controlled by German counter part ,due to which no good quality of work as well as indian manager does not bother about the indian colleagues. 3.German colleagues wont trust indian employee as well as india manager wont fight for the quality of work & solving the trust issue. 4.No salary Hike/Promotion as everything is controlled by German counter part i.e when German counter part say to give Hike/Promotion then only indian manager will give. 5.Till last year in Development team we were 5 people but now only 1 person left because no one is happy about the quality of work. 6.From past 1 year in Bangalore company was not able to hire even single resource in development team. Now German colleague told that if they are not able to increase head count in Bangalore they will close the Development team here. Due to this company is offering unrealistic offer to candidate who are looking for Job but still no one is joining. So you can think of the condition. 7.No Proper HR Policy. At last i would say it is not a Automotive company so not good for Autosar developer & embedded developer

Pros: Pretty relaxed, mostly no pressure
Cons: Most people work in silos. No transparency at all. Promotions are NOT based on skill, achievement, experience. Don't expect to be promoted unless you are exactly alike your manager. No opportunities to learn, to advance your career, or to move from your position, unless, as I said, you fit a pre-defined profile, and are in-group with certain people. If you just need a ob - go for it, but don't expect to be valued or to grow.
